settings.heading: Service Warranty Policy
settings.description:
At East Texas Electronics, we stand behind the quality of our parts and labor. We offer a 1-Year Limited Warranty (the "Warranty") on all services we provide, unless we've discussed otherwise with you before starting your project. A project is considered started at or before the time you approve our quote.

What Our Warranty Covers
Covered Services: This Warranty covers any defects in parts we've supplied and the labor we've performed for your device's repair service.

Exclusions:
This Warranty does not cover issues arising from misuse, abuse, accidents, unauthorized repairs, or maintenance not performed by us.
We're not responsible for software issues, data loss, or data corruption unless it's a direct result of our repair.
Components or services not performed by the Company, including but not limited to parts supplied by the customer or any third-party services.
Normal wear and tear and any consequential damages or incidental expenses resulting from a breach of this Warranty are excluded.
Any consequential damages or incidental expenses resulting from any breach of this Warranty.

Making a Warranty Claim
How to Claim: If you encounter an issue with our service or parts within the Warranty period, please reach out to us with a detailed description of the problem.

Our Responsibility: If the issue is covered by our Warranty, we will, at our discretion, fix the device using new or refurbished parts, replace it with a similar device, or refund the service charge. Any parts or devices replaced will become our property.

Limitations: This Warranty is for you, the original customer, and cannot be transferred. Service under this Warranty does not extend its duration.

General Terms
Limit of Our Liability: Our responsibility under this Warranty is limited to repair, replacement, or refund. We're not liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages from using or being unable to use your device.

Governing Law: This Warranty is governed by the laws of Texas, without giving effect to any principles of conflicts of law.

Changes to the Warranty: We may update this Warranty's terms at any time, but the terms in place when you received your service will apply to any claim you make.

Severability: If any part of this Warranty is deemed unlawful or unenforceable, the rest remains in effect.
